result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Justin M. Kuhl was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
On Mr. Kuhl's Petition to Exempt Vehicles: 
[MK] case called at 8:15am. 
Defendant Justin M. Kuhl in court. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Kuhl confirms that Attorney Klein is not representing him further on this case, so he is appearing without counsel on his Petition. 
In response to the Court's inquiries of Mr. Kuhl regarding consideration of any financial hardship when Mr. Kuhl has five registered vehicles, Mr. Kuhl indicates that the subject vehicles are all gone-- they have been sold for parts or otherwise disposed of.  Mr. Kuhl indicates that he has maintained registration of the vehicles because that is what the Division of Motor Vehicles told him to do. 
The Court denies the Petition; the Court finds there is not an undue financial hardship situation.  The Court voices that it believes that Mr. Kuhl has been mis-directed on the vehicle registration issue 
recess 8:21am.
The Petition is denied because the Court finds that: It should be set for a hearing.
to Exempt Vehicles from Ignition Interlock
The Court has already exercised its discretion on this matter and no valid reason is presented to reconsider. pc: all
From defendant requesting reinstatement of Huber privileges.
Approved for limited Huber for CSW purposed ONLY - Judge Wambach
Petition for reinstatement reviewed and denied - Judge Wambach
from Defendant requesting huber privileges be reinstated
Counsel's request is denied as was Mr. Kuhl's
from Attorney Klein requesting huber privileges be reinstated for the defendant
from Jail re: revocation of Huber

records.addlTxt: Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Cases 15CF160 and 15CF385 called together at 3:51pm [mo]
Defendant Justin M. Kuhl in court with Attorney Jessica A Klein.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 15CF385:
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1 of Case 15CF385 and Count #1 of 15CF160:
The Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Kuhl on Probation for a term of 3 years, with conditons:

--As to Case 15CF385: To serve  6 months   in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--Days credit for time already served: 1 day 
--As to Case 15CF385: To pay the minimum fine plus costs
--As to Case 15CF160: to pay statutory costs

The Court adopts the conditions of probation as outlined in the CCS.
[which are: 
--absolute sobriety
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid DL and agent approval 
--no possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--submit to UA's at the discretion of the DOC
--not engage in any acts or threats of violence
--undergo any assessment, treatment, or therapies as directed by DOC
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per agent ]

The Court orders, as to Case 15CF385 only: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 33 months
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 33 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

The Court does not order a victim impact panel 
recess: 4:14pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 24, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case called at 8:10am [mo]
[Voluntary Appearance on SCRAM violation]
Defendant Justin M. Kuhl in court with Attorney Jessica A Klein.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the warrant has been executed, given the appearance of Mr. Kuhl, the Court orders the warrant be removed from any database.
Upon inquiry of the Court, the State indicates that due to lack of notice, the State is not prepared to proceed to an evidentiary hearing today.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

NEXT:  As to Case 15CF385: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/2/16 at 10:00am    (2) Status Conference on 4/18/16 at 3:00pm
            As to Case 15CF160: (1) FSSC on 4/18/16 at 3:00pm (2)Jury Trial on 4/21/16 at 8:30am(JA please send Scheduling Order w/NOHs)
Attorney Jessica Klein, with Cover Letter
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 9:49 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Justin M. Kuhl in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Kuhl indicates that he will be getting counsel in this case, but would like to proceed with initial appearance today

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $2000 signature bond, with conditions:
- The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.
The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 11/23/15 at sometime prior to 3:30 pm.  
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-Booking at JCSD 
Recess: 9:56 am 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 12/23/15 at 2:40 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 2/2/16 at 10:30 am - Send notices
